1.text: Work with clean, dry kitchen tools and dishes.

2.text: Fill the bottom of your double boiler with water and heat it.

3.text: Measure the chocolate you need and add it to the top of a double boiler.

4.text: Stir the chocolate constantly until it melts.

5.text: Remove the bowl from the heat and use the chocolate immediately.

6.text: Measure out how much chocolate you want to melt and break it up.

7.text: Place the chocolate into a microwave-safe bowl.

8.text: Microwave the chocolate on the lowest heat setting for 15-30 seconds.

9.text: Stir the chocolate and microwave it again for 10-15 seconds, if necessary.

10.text: Place a liner in your slow cooker to make cleanup easy.

11.text: Chop bars of chocolate into uniform pieces.

12.text: Heat the chocolate in the slow cooker on high for an hour.

13.text: Turn the heat to low and stir the chocolate every 15 minutes for an hour.
